/work/doc/pages/ThreadingModels.md
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 \defgroup threading-models Threading Models
2 \ingroup advanced-programming
3 
4 \details
5 
6 The handler supports the following threading models for usual sockets:
7 
8 - OnixS::B3::BOE::ThreadingModel::Dedicated
9 - OnixS::B3::BOE::ThreadingModel::Pool
10 - OnixS::B3::BOE::ThreadingModel::External
11 
12 The OnixS::B3::BOE::ThreadingModel::External mode supports the Solarflare TCPDirect technology that is described
13 in the \ref tcpdirect section.
14 
15 The model is configured via the OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionSettings::threadingModel(ThreadingModel::Enum value) method.
16 
17 \section Dedicated
18 
19 In OnixS::B3::BOE::ThreadingModel::Dedicated mode the Handler creates a dedicated receiving thread and
20 a dedicated sending thread for each OnixS::B3::BOE::Session instance.
21 
22 The receiving thread receives and processes incoming SBE messages.
23 
24 The Handler tries to send an outgoing application-level message in the thread that calls
25 the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::send method.
26 If the message cannot be sent immediately, then it is saved to the queue for the subsequent sending by the sending thread.
27 This behavior can be changed using the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::messageGrouping method.
28 
29 The following table shows which thread could fire a particular callback.
30 
31 | Callback | Application thread| Sending thread | Receiving thread |
32 |-----------------------------------------------------|--------------------|---------------|------------------|
33 | OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionListener::onError | No | Yes | Yes |
34 | `OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionListener::on*(messageName)` | No | No | Yes |
35 | OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionListener::onReceivedBytes | No | No | Yes |
36 | OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionListener::onMessageSending | Yes | Yes | Yes |
37 | OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionListener::onStateChange | Yes | Yes | Yes |
38 | OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionListener::onWarning | Yes | Yes | Yes |
39 
40 \section Pool
41 
42 In OnixS::B3::BOE::ThreadingModel::Pool mode the Handler creates the thread pool and shares it between all sessions.
43 The maximum number of threads in the pool is configured via the OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionSettings::threadPoolSize parameter.
44 The default value (`0`) of this parameter means that the thread pool's size will be equal to the CPU's number.
45 In the thread pool, each thread performs read/write operations and can process a number of different FIXP connections,
46 which are distributed equally among all threads.
47 The thread pool is used also to perform the asynchronous TCP connect when the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::connectAsync()
48 method is called.
49 
50 \section External
51 
52 In OnixS::B3::BOE::ThreadingModel::External mode the Handler does not create I/O threads. Such mode means that user
53 creates additional threads himself (or uses the main thread),
54 then performs event dispatching in a loop by calling the OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionReactor::dispatchEvents() routine.
55 This mode supports the Solarflare's TCPDirect and regular TCP connections. For TCPDirect connections,
56 one should use the OnixS::B3::BOE::TcpDirectStack as a reactor.
57 For regular TCP connections, one should use OnixS::B3::BOE::TcpStandardStack as a reactor.
58 
59 \note
60 The TCPDirect technology is NOT thread-safe. Therefore, the event dispatching and message sending should be performed
61 from the same thread.
62 
63 \note
64 OnixS::B3::BOE::ThreadingModel::External mode is set automatically when an external reactor is provided to
65 the session's constructor, regardless of which threading model was specified by SessionSettings.
66 If OnixS::B3::BOE::ThreadingModel::External mode is configured,
67 but an external reactor is not provided during Session's construction, an exception will be thrown.
68 
69 \section additional-threads-that-can-be-spawned Additional Threads That Can Be Spawned
70 
71 If the configured threading model equals OnixS::B3::BOE::ThreadingModel::Dedicated and
72 the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::connectAsync() method is used,
73 the Handler creates a separate thread to perform the asynchronous TCP connect.
74 Each such thread is started when the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::connectAsync() method is called and is stopped
75 when the asynchronous TCP connect is completed.
76 
77 If the OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionStorageType::AsyncFileBased value is passed to the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session constructor,
78 the Handler creates an additional thread for each `Session` instance.
79 This thread performs session storage operations.
80 
81 When a session has some network issues, the Handler will restore the FIXP connection.
82 For this purpose, a separate thread is created to avoid blocking Handler's IO threads in non-TCPDirect connection modes.
